page.title: 09A Day In Haverfordwest
page.content: It's an ordinary Saturday, and there is no school. I Wake up, eat my breakfast and watch some T.V. and then go out to play with my friends. We play races on our bikes. We also play "mob", a simple game where we pick someone to be "it" and they have to count to a certain number while the others go to hide. The person who is "it" shouts "Mob So & So 1 2 3". Later we play "Tig" which is a game with a lot of running and chasing sometimes called "Tag". After playing I have my dinner, bacon and chips, my Mum's chips are like long fingers. After playing again I go indoors for my tea when I have biscuits and cake and then I go out for a short play on my bike and then I come in for supper which is meat, potatoes, carrots and gravy. I then watch a film on video and go to bed.
